name.value: How Game Are You? Couples Intimacy Edition

item.description:
'How Game Are You' is a series of games designed to broach difficult conversations but in a fun and inclusive way. Players learn, have fun, converse and connect with each other.

This first game is targeted at Couples seeking more emotional and physical intimacy. It is tasteful, above the line and fun.

Cards are categorised as:

 Pledge cards to read before the game and ensure presence 
 Q and A (Question and you Answer)
 Would You Rather? (Answer or act out, or lose places)
 True or False? (Trivia style)
 Trust And Touch (Blindfold guessing)
 Name If Game (Picture cards to name what it is)
 Perform or Pamper (Personal Challenge cards selected at the end of the game)


150 of the main cards are ranked 1, 2 or 3 chili's to identify the difficulty and lower or higher places forward on the board. There's an additional 25 x 4 chili cards in a sealed tuckbox. These contain images to guess and name, but are product photo's or illustrations so sexual in nature but tasteful and not graphic.

Players can be one couple or two couples playing against each other. The cards are placed into 3 decks depending on the chili rating (chilli in UK spelling) and people choose an easier 1 chilli to start the game, then work up eventually to the tougher conversations and topics. Questions are asked and based on your answers, you move your marker the respective moves on the board to hopefully be first to the finish/ Win!!

The WINNER then selects a 'Perform or Pamper' card for themself and for the losing player, and all of this while receiving a 1 minute shoulder massage from the Loser. Each card has an activity they must complete within 14 days OR they have to give extra special attention to the other person, in whatever 'reasonable' way they want.

Each game is designed to last 30 - 60 minutes depending on how much extra conversation ensues about the cards. The cards should give about 5 unique games, but many answers are unique, so it can be played multiple times.

The game content has been professionally reviewed by a psychologist for suitability.
